author: Staff Reporter
text:
The body of Syed Imthiyas being taken in an ambulance from Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College Hosptial in Salem on Sunday.

Three days after an autorickshaw driver Syed Imthiyas (24) was found dead near the railway track at Omalur in a suspected case of honour killing, the parents received the body and buried it in the village on Sunday evening.

The victim was in love with a caste Hindu girl and her relatives were opposed to their relationship, triggering an allegation from Imthiyas’ kin that he was murdered.

Imthiyas’ parents, Syed Sultan and Piyari Begum, received the body from the mortuary at Government Mohan Kumaramangalam Medical College and Hospital on Sunday afternoon in the presence of relatives and members of Muslim and Dalit outfits.

It was taken to his house in Komaliyur and subsequently to the burial ground on the Omalur–Mettur main road and buried.

A strong police contingent, led by Superintendent of Police G. Subbulakshmi, provided security for the burial. Police personnel were posted in the village and in the burial ground.

Earlier in the day, the victim’s parents with members of various outfits met Salem Collector V. Sampath and submitted a petition seeking a fair probe into his death. Members of the outfits told the media that the Collector promised to transfer the case from the Dharmapuri railway police to the Salem district police and form a special team to probe the case.
title: Muslim youth buried amid tight security in Salem
